founder_case_studies.description: Real fantasy decisions made by founder Joseph - both good and bad - for learning analysis
founder_case_studies.purpose: Demonstrate mutual learning philosophy and provide authentic decision-making examples

decision_timeline.rationale: Believed in Lions offense upside, Gibbs talent

decision_timeline.trigger_event: Puka Nacua placed on IR - WR room decimated
decision_timeline.panic_decision: Traded Gibbs for Brandon Aiyuk + Braelon Allen (Breece handcuff)
rationale: Aiyuk should pace WR1 numbers with CMC injured
More available target share for Aiyuk
Worried about Gibbs hamstring injury concerns from summer

outcome_reality.aiyuk_result: Blew out knee, went on IR
outcome_reality.gibbs_result: Legendary season, never got hurt, Montgomery injured making Gibbs nuclear
outcome_reality.season_impact: Trade essentially botched entire season despite elite draft

recovery_attempts.action: Traded Aiyuk in deal to acquire CeeDee Lamb
recovery_attempts.outcome: Dak Prescott went on IR, further complications

learning_analysis.decision_type: Panic trade driven by immediate need
cognitive_biases: Injury paranoia - summer concerns overrode talent evaluation
Immediate gratification - needed WR help right now
context_factors: Didn't account for Montgomery injury possibility
learning_analysis.founder_reflection: Reflected on this for months - legitimately that bad of a decision

tiber_analysis_framework.user_context_recognition: Classic panic trade scenario - urgent positional need
empathy_points: Injury decimation creates real roster crisis
Week 3 pressure to fix problems quickly
Reasonable concerns about Gibbs injury history
educational_value: Don't trade elite draft capital in panic situations
Injury concerns often overblown vs talent level
Immediate needs vs long-term value tradeoffs
tiber_analysis_framework.mutual_learning: Demonstrates even founders make questionable decisions worth analyzing

learning_principles.no_perfection_claims: Neither founder nor Tiber claim fantasy decision-making perfection
learning_principles.mistake_value: Bad decisions become case studies for community learning
learning_principles.empathy_building: Understanding why smart people make questionable choices
learning_principles.bias_recognition: Identifying cognitive biases in decision-making process
